  README
  -------
  
  The ParcelTrack API returns back a base 64 encoded string(parcelTrackSignature). This should be decoded into a 8-bit integer array(decodedSignature). Pairs of integers in this 8-bit array correspond to vector points i.e. decodedSignature[0] is equivalent to 255, decodedSignature[1] is equivalent to 23,  decodedSignature[2] is equivalent to 72 and so forth.
 
  Using these points, the customer's signature can be drawn with the following in mind:
 
  1. A signature can comprise of several vector images. If the first digit in a pair is 255, then that denotes the end of the current vector image(currentVector). The number is ignored as the first value for the next pair.
 
  2. Applying the logic to the above; we ignore the first number and the first point is 23,72.
 
  3. If the pair contains 0, discard the pair.
 
  Vectors can be drawn many ways, on the nzpost.co.nz website signatures are drawn using the SVG HTML element (where each polyline element is equivalent to a vector image i.e. an item in our signatureVector list).
 
  Full example:
  --------------
  1. Base 64 encoded signature returned from ParcelTrack V3 (8478673305000601NAP003AS):
 
  "signature": ""
 
  2. Decoded 8-bit integer array:
  
  255 24 50 24 50 24 50 24 50 24 50 23 50 23 50 23 51 23 51 23 51 23 51 22 52 22 52 22 53 22 53 22 54 21 55 21 55 21 55 21 56 21 57 21 57 21 58 21 59 21 59 21 59 21 60 21 60 21 60 21 61 21 61 21 61 22 61 22 61 23 61 24 61 24 61 25 61 26 60 27 60 28 59 30 58 31 57 32 57 35 55 36 54 37 54 39 52 40 51 40 50 42 49 43 47 44 47 45 45 46 44 47 44 48 42 49 41 49 41 50 39 50 38 50 38 51 37 52 36 52 35 53 34 54 33 54 32 55 32 56 30 56 30 57 29 58 28 58 28 59 27 59 26 59 26 60 25 60 25 60 24 61 24 61 23 61 23 61 23 62 22 62 22 62 22 62 21 62 21 63 21 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 20 63 21 63 21 63 21 62 21 62 21 62 21 62 21 62 21 62 21 62 21 62 21 62 22 62 22 62 22 62 22 62 22 62 23 62 23 62 23 62 23 61 23 61 24 61 24 61 24 61 25 60 26 60 26 60 26 59 27 59 28 58 28 57 29 57 30 57 31 56 32 55 32 55 33 54 34 54 35 54 35 53 37 52 37 52 38 52 39 51 40 51 41 50 42 50 43 50 43 49 45 49 46 49 46 48 47 48 47 48 47 48 48 47 49 47 49 47 49 47 50 47 50 47 50 46 51 46 51 46 51 46 51 46 51 46 51 46 51 46 51 46 52 46 52 46 52 46 52 46 52 46 52 46 53 46 53 46 53 47 53 47 53 47 53 47 53 47 54 47 54 47 54 48 54 48 54 48 54 48 55 49 55 49 55 49 55 49 55 49 55 50 55 50 55 50 55 51 55 51 55 51 55 52 55 53 55 53 55 54 55 55 55 57 55 57 55 58 55 59 54 60 54 61 54 62 53 62 53 64 52 65 51 65 51 67 51 68 50 68 50 69 49 71 48 71 48 72 47 73 46 73 46 74 46 75 45 75 44 76 44 77 43 77   3. Applying the above logic to the 8-bit integer array:

   Vector Image 4:

   4. Drawing the image using a SVG HTML element (https://www.nzpost.co.nz/tools/tracking/item/8478673305000601NAP003AS):
   
   <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="tracking-sig" width="256" height="128"><style>polyline.sigline { fill: none; stroke: black; stroke-width: 1px; }</style>
   
   <polyline class="sigline" points="24,50 24,50 24,50 24,50 24,50 23,50 23,50 23,51 23,51 23,51 23,51 22,52 22,52 22,53 22,53 22,54 21,55 21,55 21,55 21,56 21,57 21,57 21,58 21,59 21,59 21,59 21,60
